subject: QS news update Nov 25
msgSnippet: I have changed the dictionary that converts the QS news. You will notice that the combination that was formerly Ado Roar is now just plain Roar. So the word
messageBody:
I have changed the dictionary that converts the QS news. You will notice
that the combination that was formerly Ado Roar is now just plain Roar.
So the word "utter" should not appear as:

Ado Tut Roar

I made this change to test out a new way of handling the ambiguous
combination of "ar," when forming the sound in "bird" or "nurse." We had
situation in which the word "arrest" and "urban" both started with Ado
Roar, but each had a very different sound. Anthony has made a suggestion
to simply get rid of the vowel before the "r" in words like "urban," but
to keep it for words like "arrest."

This is just an experiment as we try to work out a solution, so let me
know any difficulties you have, and what you think.

Paul

I have changed the dictionary that converts the QS news. You will notice 
that the combination that was formerly Ado Roar is now just plain Roar. 
So the word "utter" should not appear as:

Ado Tut Roar

I made this change to test out a new way of handling the ambiguous 
combination of "ar," when forming the sound in "bird" or "nurse." We had 
situation in which the word "arrest" and "urban" both started with Ado 
Roar, but each had a very different sound. Anthony has made a suggestion 
to simply get rid of the vowel before the "r" in words like "urban," but 
to keep it for words like "arrest."

This is just an experiment as we try to work out a solution, so let me 
know any difficulties you have, and what you think.

Paul
